This may not last forever either, if Bitcoin ever became a stable global measure of wealth, the “recoupling” also may occur. The reality is that today, crypto assets are traded against BTC sentiment, which is not rational.

The “decoupling” happens when crypto assets are valued on their intrinsic value, against a more stable measure, not against the fluctuating relative value of BTC. Security tokens in particular will not be coupled to BTC but rather their yield in their respective currencies.

All of that said, fiat terms will become meaningless if we can someday price everything in a stable-ish # cryptoasset, which could plausibly be tied to its own intrinsically generated value.

It is really the *uncertainty* around future price that induces a mental tax on spending a # cryptoasset, presenting a bull case for a successful stablecoin as a psychologically simple unit of account.

Hypothesis: we will need to stop thinking about paying for crypto services, in *crypto terms.* Better to think about the services, and perhaps to present the services, in *dollar terms.* Why? Fiat has less appreciation potential, making it less psychologically painful to spend.
